The Last of Us 2 represents how games sh: Before I submit this review I wanna make it clear that my displeasure with this game has nothing to do with having a female lead\, or any sorta lgbt representation. (So don’t pull the bigot card). Joel’s death was handled piss poorly\, I wouldn’t have had a problem with Joel being killed if it was done differently\, it’s amazing to think that in the 1st game Joel has evaded many of the infected\, impaled on a metal rod\, has always been discreet and untrusting of others\, only to trust a group of randoms with loaded guns in a locked room\, and gets golfed to death in the sequel. Abby was not a well executed character IMO\, I felt like Abby should’ve never been included in TLOU2. I wanted this game to be more focused on the already established relationship between Joel and Ellie and add more to it. It’s hard to have any care for Abby when she brutally kills Joel\, kills Jesse\, shoots Tommy in the face\, and beats on Ellie and Dina. And while we’re forced to play as this spec ops gorilla brutalizing our favorite characters (Specifically Joel & Ellie)\, ND somehow expects us to feel some kinda connection for her? Overall I’m very disappointed with this game\, the ending was extremely lackluster and nothing was accomplished.
